refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: The main configuration file is located at /etc/tokentube/tokentube.conf, although another location can be specified at program invocation time.
For clarification purposes only: The following configuration directives are expressed by their full formal name. Given the following configuration snippet example:
The configuration directive "storage.user-files.owner" would thus yield the value "root" and "storage.user-files.group" would yield the value "adm" in this example.
This section configures the storage aspects (as used by the "default" plugin) for the user records, which contain the (password encrypted) keys.

listitem.para: Specifies the directory in which the files that represent individual users are located (if no other storage-subsystem is used (provided by plugins).
This configuration directive is required and has no default value. By convention the directory /boot/tokentube/user is used.
Specifies the to-be-used hash-algorithm for calculating the filename for the files that represent individual users.
The hash may be specified by name or by its OID notation (or "null").
This configuration directive is required and has no default value.
Specifies the to-be-set owner of the files that represent individual users.
The owner may be specified by name or by the numeric value.
If configuration directive is left unconfigured then any created files will be assigned to the user of the creating process.
Specifies the to-be-set group of the files that represent individual users.
The group may be specified by name or by the numeric value.
If configuration directive is left unconfigured then any created files will be assigned the primary group of the creating process.
Specifies the to-be-set permission of the files that represent individual users.
The permission must be specified in octal notation.
If configuration directive is left unconfigured then any created files will obtain the permissions as designated by the umask of the creating process.

refsect1.para: This section configures the storage aspects (as used by the "default" plugin) for handling user records, most notably the conditions for automatically creating (enrolling) user accounts not yet managed by tokentube.

listitem.para: Specifies the minimum numeric uid value a user account must have in order to be automatically enrolled to TokenTube (creation of user in TokenTube database) upon user login.
This configuration directive has no default value.
Specifies the maximum numeric uid value a user account must have in order to be automatically enrolled to TokenTube (creation of user in TokenTube database) upon user login.
This configuration directive has no default value.
Specifies the minimum numeric gid value a user account must have in order to be automatically enrolled to TokenTube (creation of user in TokenTube database) upon user login.
This configuration directive has no default value.
Specifies the maximum numeric gid value a user account must have in order to be automatically enrolled to TokenTube (creation of user in TokenTube database) upon user login.
This configuration directive has no default value.

Specifies the group names (as a comma separated list) that a user account must be assigned to (at least to one of them) in order to be automatically enrolled to TokenTube (resulting in the creation of a user record in the TokenTube database) upon user login.
This configuration directive has no default value.

Specifies the directory in which (if configured) symlinks to the actual user files (refer to storage.user-files.directory and storage.user-files.filename-hash) are located. This is useful when enumeration of enrolled users is required since the actual username is obfuscated in the user database (refer to storage.user-files.filename-hash).
This configuration directive has no default value.
Specifies the number of bits to use when creating new OTP records in the TokenTube database. The number must be a multiple of 16 and the range must be within 64 and 256.
The length of OTP challenges and responses is linearly dependant on this setting.
This configuration directive has no default value.
Specifies the cryptographic block cipher (and mode) to be employed for all cryptographic operations by TokenTube.
Valid options include any one OID supported by the installed libgcrypt or of the following internally predefined strings (which map to the corresponding OID):
listitem.literallayout: AES-256-CFB AES-256-OFB AES-256-CBC AES-192-CFB AES-192-OFB AES-192-CBC AES-128-CFB AES-128-OFB AES-128-CBC
listitem.para: This configuration directive has no default value.
Specifies the cryptographic hash function to be employed for all hashing operations by TokenTube.
Valid options include any one OID supported by the installed libgcrypt or of the following internally predefined strings (which map to the corresponding OID):
This configuration directive has no default value.
Specifies the cryptographic key derivative function to be employed for all key derivation operations by TokenTube.
Valid options include the following internally predefined strings:
This configuration directive has no default value.
Specifies the number of iterations to be conducted for all key derivation operations by TokenTube.
Any positive integer is a valid value.
This configuration directive has no default value.
Specifies which of the (potentially configured) plugins should be loaded. The list has to be comma-separated.
This configuration directive has no default value.

Configuration section for a plugin, which is specified with a unique (descriptive) name - provided here as a title to the section. The name is the one that must be listed in plugins.enabled for the plugin to be actually loaded.
This configuration section requires a unique name.
Specifies the filename of the object that will be loaded as a shared library and initiate the plugin. It is recommended to specify the filename with its full path.
This configuration directive has no default value.
Specifies the filename of the object that will be loaded as the configuration for the plugin. It is recommended to specify filename with its full path.
This configuration directive has no default value.
